aquarium.hw

Interface TemperatureSensor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Observable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    TestTemperatureSensor

    public interface TemperatureSensor
extends Observable

    The TemperatureSensor is a sensor that tests water temperature. It periodically tests the temperature in the water and when the temperature raises or lowers by a specified delta, it notifies any observer object.

    The delta indicates when to notify any observers that the temperature has changed. The sensor uses the absolute value of the delta. That is, a delta of 0.5 is the same as a delta of -0.5.

    When the sensor is initialized (the specific constructor is invoked), the first temperature reading is used to begin reporting (i.e. is used as the last reported temperature). When the temperature changes by +/- the delta value from the last reported temperature, all observers are notified of the change and that temperature becomes the last reported temperature that is used to indicate when to send out the next notification to the observers.

    Version:
    Jul 27, 2016

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getTemperature()
      A getter for the temperature.
      void setDelta(double delta)
      Set the delta for the sensor to the specified delta.

      • Methods inherited from interface aquarium.Observable

        addObserver, removeObserver

    • Method Detail

      • setDelta

        void setDelta(double delta)
        Set the delta for the sensor to the specified delta. This will cause the sensor to notify observers when the absolute value of the difference between the current temperature and the last reported temperature is greater than or equal to the delta.
        Parameters:
        delta - the new delta

      • getTemperature

        double getTemperature()
        A getter for the temperature. The normal way of obtaining the temperature is through notifications by giving the sensor an observer. This is an alternate way to get a single snapshot of the current temperature.
        Returns:
        the current temperature from the sensor
